trans-unit.source: Maintains a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Binding"></xref> between an object's property and a data-bound control property.

The PropertyManager inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase>, and it is used to maintain the current property of an object, rather than the property of a current object in a list.
For this reason, trying to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.Position%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.Count%2A> property for a PropertyManager has no effect.

Similarly, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.AddNew%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.RemoveAt%2A> methods are not supported because there is no underlying list of data to add to or delete from.

In addition, a call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.IsBindingSuspended%2A> will always return `false` if the PropertyManager has a data source, regardless of whether <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.SuspendBinding%2A> has been called.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyManager"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, adds a new item to the underlying list.
When overridden in a derived class, cancels the current edit.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of rows managed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase"></xref>.
The number of rows managed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase"></xref>.
Gets the object to which the data-bound property belongs.
The Current property returns the data source of a data-bound relationship.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the object to which the property belongs.
When overridden in a derived class, ends the current edit.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the name of the list supplying the data for the binding.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> containing the table's bound properties.
The name of the list supplying the data for the binding.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.CurrentChanged"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.CurrentItemChanged"></xref> event.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref:System.EventArgs> containing the event data.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the position in the underlying list that controls bound to this data source point to.
A zero-based index that specifies a position in the underlying list.
When overridden in a derived class, deletes the row at the specified index from the underlying list.
The index of the row to delete.
When overridden in a derived class, resumes data binding.
Suspends the data binding between a data source and a data-bound property.
SuspendBinding and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyManager.ResumeBinding%2A> are two methods that allow the temporary suspension and resumption of data binding.
You typically suspend data binding if the user must be allowed to make several edits to data fields before validation occurs.
For example, if one field must be changed in accordance with a second, but where validating the first field would cause the second field to be in error.

A call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.IsBindingSuspended%2A> will always return `false` if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyManager> has a data source, regardless of whether <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.SuspendBinding%2A> has been called.
Updates the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Binding"></xref> between a data binding and a data-bound property.
